problem_data.title: Groups of Special-Equivalent Strings
problem_data.description:
You are given an array of strings of the same length words.
In one move, you can swap any two even indexed characters or any two odd indexed characters of a string words[i].
Two strings words[i] and words[j] are special-equivalent if after any number of moves, words[i] == words[j].
A group of special-equivalent strings from words is a non-empty subset of words such that:

Every pair of strings in the group are special equivalent, and
The group is the largest size possible (i.e., there is not a string words[i] not in the group such that words[i] is special-equivalent to every string in the group).
Return the number of groups of special-equivalent strings from words.

examples.explanation: One group is ["abcd", "cdab", "cbad"], since they are all pairwise special equivalent, and none of the other strings is all pairwise special equivalent to these. The other two groups are ["xyzz", "zzxy"] and ["zzyx"]. Note that in particular, "zzxy" is not special equivalent to "zzyx".
